item.title: 美光18亿美元收购案提振力晶科技股价
item.description: 台湾力晶半导体制造股份有限公司股价周一上涨近10%，此前美国内存芯片制造商美光科技宣布将收购该公司的一座晶圆厂。【原文：Shares of Taiwan’s Powerchip Semiconductor Manufacturing Corp rose nearly 10% on Monday after U.S. memory chipmaker Micron Technology said it would buy a fabrication plant from the company.】

item.title: 日本大选临近，消费税下调可能性增大
item.description: 日本即将举行的提前大选很可能导致消费税率下调，因为执政党和在野党高层周日均强调，有必要通过降税来缓解家庭因生活成本上升而承受的压力。【原文：Japan's expected snap general election is increasingly likely to lead to a cut in the consumption tax rate, as ruling and opposition party executives on Sunday stressed the need to do so to cushion the hit to households from rising living costs.】

item.title: 乐施会称：亿万富翁财富创历史新高，影响力持续扩大
item.description: 反贫困组织乐施会周一表示，去年全球亿万富翁财富增速达到近年平均水平的三倍，创下历史新高，加剧了威胁民主稳定的经济与政治分化。【原文：Billionaire wealth surged at three times its recent pace last year to reach its highest level on record, deepening economic and political divides that threaten democratic stability, anti-poverty group ​Oxfam said on Monday.】

item.title: 美元承压，避险资产走高，因特朗普就格陵兰问题加码关税
item.description: 美元周一走低，因特朗普总统就格陵兰问题对欧洲发出最新关税威胁令投资者感到不安，资金涌入避险资产日元和瑞士法郎，市场整体呈现避险情绪。【原文：The dollar fell on Monday, as investors unnerved by U.S. President Donald Trump's latest tariff threats against Europe over Greenland piled ​into the safe-haven yen and Swiss franc, in a broad risk-averse ‌move across markets.】

item.title: 澳大利亚西拉资源公司为特斯拉石墨供应协议争取更多时间
item.description: 澳大利亚西拉资源公司周一表示，已与特斯拉达成协议，将解决涉嫌违反石墨供应协议的最后期限第三次延期。【原文：Australia's Syrah Resources said on Monday it agreed with Tesla to extend for the third time a deadline to resolve an alleged breach of their graphite supply agreement.】

item.title: 华尔街期货下跌，美元因美国关税威胁走低
item.description: 美国股市期货周一走低，此前总统特朗普威胁对八个欧洲国家加征关税，直至美国获准购买格陵兰岛，此举导致美元兑避险货币日元和瑞士法郎走弱。【原文：U.S. stock futures slid on Monday after President Donald Trump threatened to slap extra tariffs on eight European nations until the U.S. is allowed ​to buy Greenland, pushing the dollar down on the safe-haven yen and Swiss franc.】

item.title: 中国经济有望实现2025年增长目标，尽管第四季度表现疲软，前景仍趋暗淡
item.description: 中国第四季度经济增速可能放缓至三年低点，因内需疲软；尽管全年增速有望接近政府目标，但贸易紧张局势和结构性失衡对经济前景构成重大风险。【原文：China's economic growth likely slowed to a three‑year low in the fourth quarter as domestic demand softened, and while the full‑year pace is ​set to hit close to Beijing's target, trade tensions and structural imbalances pose significant risks to the outlook.】

item.title: 《金融时报》报道，欧盟正考虑对美国实施1080亿美元的报复性关税，以回应特朗普对格陵兰岛的威胁。
item.description: 据《金融时报》周日报道，欧洲各国首都可能对美国征收价值930亿欧元（1077.1亿美元）的关税，或限制美国企业进入欧盟市场，以回应美国总统特朗普对反对其收购格陵兰岛计划的北约盟国的威胁。【原文：European capitals may hit the U.S. with 93 billion euros ($107.71 billion) worth of tariffs or restrict American companies from the bloc's market in response to U.S. President Donald Trump's threats to NATO allies opposed to his campaign to take over Greenland, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁对欧洲加征更多关税以示对格陵兰岛的立场，市场神经紧绷
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普承诺，在允许美国收购格陵兰岛之前，将对部分欧洲国家的进口商品加征关税。此举可能在周一金融市场重启时引发剧烈震荡。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump has promised to implement further tariffs on imports of goods from some European countries until the U.S. is allowed to acquire Greenland, a move that could send a jolt through financial markets when they reopen on Monday.】

item.title: 允许优步、来福车在以色列运营的法案获委员会批准
item.description: 以色列部长委员会周日批准了一项法律，允许优步和Lyft等拼车服务在以色列运营，旨在降低出租车费用。【原文：An Israeli ministerial committee on Sunday approved a law that would allow shared ride hailing services such as Uber and Lyft to operate in Israel in a bid to lower taxi costs.】

item.title: 爱尔兰表示，欧盟必将对美国任何新关税采取报复措施，这一点毋庸置疑。
item.description: 欧盟将对美国因格陵兰问题对欧洲盟友实施关税威胁采取报复措施，但爱尔兰总理周日表示，考虑动用欧盟"反胁迫工具"为时尚早。【原文：The European Union will retaliate if U.S. tariff threats against European allies over Greenland materialise, but it is premature to consider using the bloc's "Anti-Coercion Instrument", Ireland's prime minister said on Sunday.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁对欧洲加征关税，全球市场面临新一轮冲击
item.description: 全球市场本周面临新一轮波动，此前美国总统特朗普誓言对八个欧洲国家征收关税，直至美国获准购买格陵兰岛。【原文：Global markets face a fresh bout of volatility this week after President Donald Trump vowed to slap tariffs on eight European nations until the U.S. is allowed to buy Greenland.】

item.title: 据《金融时报》报道，红杉资本将与新加坡政府投资公司、Coatue共同投资Anthropic公司。
item.description: 据《金融时报》周日援引知情人士消息报道，风险投资公司红杉资本正与新加坡政府投资公司（GIC）及美国投资机构Coatue共同参与Anthropic的融资轮，该轮融资目标为250亿美元，公司估值达3500亿美元。【原文：Venture capital firm Sequoia is joining ​Singapore's GIC and U.S. investor Coatue in ‌a funding round for Anthropic which aims to raise $25 billion at a $350 billion valuation, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing sources ‌familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 韩国官员称将与美国谈判争取芯片关税优惠条款
item.description: 韩国总统府发言人周日在电视简报会上表示，韩国将就美国对内存芯片进口征收关税寻求有利条件。【原文：South Korea will seek favourable terms for U.S. tariffs on imports of memory chips, a presidential office spokesperson said at a televised briefing on Sunday.】

item.title: 特朗普政府大力推动降低汽车价格，淡化电动汽车发展
item.description: 特朗普政府汽车政策最高官员周六宣称，通过取消车辆排放法规，联邦政府正致力于降低汽车价格，因为购车负担能力仍是美国民众的核心关切。【原文：The Trump administration's top auto policy officials on Saturday touted federal efforts to lower car prices by eliminating vehicle emissions regulations, as affordability remains a key concern among Americans.】

item.title: 美国官员称欧盟应考虑将格陵兰关税问题与美欧贸易协议分开处理
item.description: 美国贸易代表杰米森·格里尔周六表示，欧洲是否愿意因格陵兰问题而面临特朗普总统对部分欧洲国家提出新的关税威胁，取决于欧洲自身的决定。【原文：U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said on Saturday it is up to Europe to decide whether it wants to raise new tariff threats from President Donald Trump against some European countries over Greenland.】

item.title: 特朗普称从未向摩根大通的戴蒙提供美联储主席职位
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普周六表示，他从未提议提名摩根大通首席执行官杰米·戴蒙担任美联储主席一职，这与本周的一份报道相矛盾。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday said he never offered to nominate JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon for the job of Federal Reserve chair, contradicting a report this week.】

item.title: 特朗普誓言对八个欧洲国家征收关税以示对格陵兰岛的立场
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普周六誓言，将在欧洲盟国对美国实施关税升级浪潮直至美国获准购买格陵兰岛，此举加剧了围绕这座丹麦广袤北极岛屿未来归属的争端。【原文：President Donald Trump on Saturday vowed to implement a wave of increasing tariffs on European allies until the United States is allowed to buy Greenland, escalating a row over the future of Denmark's vast Arctic island.】

item.title: 最高法院就美联储委员丽莎·库克任命案展开角逐，测试特朗普经济权力的边界
item.description: 去年，在唐纳德·特朗普总统第二任期开始四个月后，美国最高法院就表明了其意图保护美联储免受政治干预的立场。本周三，当大法官们审议特朗普解雇美联储理事丽莎·库克的合法性时，他们维护美国央行独立性的决心将面临考验。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court signaled four months into Donald Trump's second presidential term last year its interest in shielding the Federal Reserve from political interference. When the justices on Wednesday consider the legality of his bid to fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook, their willingness to preserve the U.S. central bank's independence will be ​put to the test.】

item.title: 美国首席执行官们对特朗普的政策提出温和反对
item.description: 周四，在美国商会首席执行官苏珊娜·克拉克于昏暗的宴会厅发表演讲时，她呼吁企业高管在捍卫自由市场对抗政府管控时"无所畏惧"，并强调美国必须保持"对世界的开放，对全球人才、商品、思想和创新的开放"。【原文：Speaking before a darkened ballroom on Thursday, U.S. Chamber of Commerce CEO Suzanne Clark called on executives to be "fearless" in defense of free markets over government control and said the U.S. must remain "open to the world, open to the global exchange of talent and goods and ideas and innovation."】

item.title: 马斯克要求OpenAI和微软归还高达1340亿美元的"不当得利"
item.description: 据周五提交的法庭文件显示，埃隆·马斯克正向OpenAI和微软索赔高达1340亿美元，他主张自己有权获得这两家公司因其早期支持人工智能初创企业而获得的"不当得利"。【原文：Elon Musk is seeking up to $134 billion from OpenAI and Microsoft , arguing he deserves the "wrongful gains" that they received from his early support of the artificial-intelligence startup, according to a court filing on Friday.】

item.title: 《金融时报》报道称欧盟将禁止中国供应商进入关键基础设施领域
item.description: 据《金融时报》周六报道，欧盟正着手逐步淘汰该地区关键基础设施中的中国制造设备，禁止华为、中兴等公司进入电信网络、太阳能系统和安检扫描仪领域。【原文：The European Union is moving to phase out Chinese‑made equipment from the zone's critical infrastructure, barring companies such as Huawei and ZTE from telecom networks, solar systems and security scanners, the Financial Times reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 韩国称美国芯片关税短期影响有限
item.description: 韩国产业通商资源部长官周六表示，美国宣布对特定先进计算芯片征收25%关税的决定，对韩国企业影响有限。【原文：South Korea's trade minister said on Saturday that a U.S. proclamation imposing a 25% tariff on certain advanced computing chips would have a limited impact on South Korean companies.】

item.title: 特朗普购入价值1亿美元债券，包括奈飞和华纳兄弟债券
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普最新披露的文件显示，他在11月中旬至12月下旬期间购入了价值约1亿美元的市政债券和公司债券，其中包括在奈飞公司与华纳兄弟探索公司宣布合并仅数周后，就购入了高达200万美元的两家公司债券。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump purchased about $100 million in municipal and corporate bonds from mid-November to late December, his latest disclosures showed, including up to $2 million in Netflix and Warner Bros Discovery bonds just weeks after the companies announced their merger.】

item.title: 据《金融时报》报道，中国禁止出口后，英伟达H200芯片零部件供应商已暂停生产
item.description: 据《金融时报》周五报道，在海关官员阻止新获批的人工智能处理器进入中国后，英伟达H200芯片的零部件供应商已暂停生产。【原文：Suppliers of parts for Nvidia's H200 have paused production after Chinese customs officials blocked shipments of the newly approved artificial intelligence processors from entering China, the Financial Times reported on Friday.】

item.title: 华尔街银行面临考验：特朗普呼吁限制信用卡利率
item.description: 美国多家银行周二面临棘手的政治考验：如何回应特朗普总统限制信用卡利率的要求。据多位行业人士透露，金融界正为此措手不及，不知如何应对。【原文：U.S. banks on Tuesday face a tricky political test in how to address a call from President Donald Trump to cap credit card interest rates - leaving the ​finance industry scrambling on how to proceed, according to several industry sources.】

item.title: 全球体育赛事面临"AI垃圾信息"的挑战
item.description: 人工智能风险管理平台Alethea针对人工智能生成虚假内容激增现象（被称为"AI垃圾内容"）的研究警告称，日益复杂的数字虚假信息正对体育团队、联赛及球迷构成风险。【原文：A study by AI risk management platform Alethea into the surge in artificial intelligence-generated fake content, dubbed "AI slop," has warned sports teams, leagues and fans of the risks posed by increasingly sophisticated digital misinformation.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，美国正考虑采取行政措施限制信用卡利率
item.description: 据彭博社周五报道，白宫正考虑采取行政措施，以落实美国总统唐纳德·特朗普关于限制信用卡利率的呼吁。该报道援引知情人士消息称。【原文：The White House is weighing an executive action to enact U.S. President Donald Trump’s call for a cap on credit card interest rates, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国铁路监管机构称联合太平洋与诺福克南方合并申请材料不完整
item.description: 美国地面运输委员会周五将联合太平洋公司与诺福克南方公司850亿美元合并提案退回要求修订，称其缺少必要信息。此次审查中，美国运输监管机构将根据2001年出台的更严格合并规则，界定"增强竞争"的具体含义。【原文：The U.S. Surface Transportation Board on Friday sent back Union Pacific’s proposed $85 billion merger with Norfolk Southern for revision, saying it lacked required information, as part of a review in which the U.S. transport regulator will define what enhanced competition means under tougher merger rules adopted in 2001.】

item.title: 美联储的杰斐逊表示，他认为鲍威尔是"最高尚正直的人"
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会副主席菲利普·杰斐逊周五回应司法部对美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔的传票时表示，他认为鲍威尔"具有最高尚的诚信品质"。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson, responding to the Department of Justice subpoena of Fed Chair ​Jerome Powell, said on Friday he considered Powell to be "of the ‌highest integrity."】
